Package Abstraction

Class Board

java.lang.Object
Abstraction.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the game board for the game. It contains the board layout, player and wall count, and various methods for manipulating the board.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    MAXWALLCOUNT
    The number of walls that can be placed on the board in total
    static final int
    SIZE
    The size of the board

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int playerNumber)
      Constructs a Board object with the specified player number.
      Parameters:
      playerNumber - the number of players in the game between 2 and 4

  • Method Details

    • getWallCount

      public int getWallCount()
      Returns the current wall count on the board.
      Returns:
      the wall count

    • setWallCount

      public void setWallCount(int wallCount)
      Sets the wall count on the board.
      Parameters:
      wallCount - the new wall count

    • getBoard

      public Case[][] getBoard()
      Returns the current board layout.
      Returns:
      the board layout

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard(Case[][] board)
      Sets the board layout.
      Parameters:
      board - the new board layout

    • getPlayerNumber

      public int getPlayerNumber()
      Returns the number of players in the game.
      Returns:
      the player number

    • setPlayerNumber

      public void setPlayerNumber(int playerNumber)
      Sets the number of players in the game.
      Parameters:
      playerNumber - the new player number

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard()
      Initializes the board with the initial layout and player placements. All the different types filled in the array are present in the "Case" enumeration.

    • show

      public void show()
      Displays the current state of the board. To make this possible, each type of the "Case" enumeration is replaced by a specific display.

    • move

      public void move(Position pos, Pawn player)
      Moves a player to a new position on the board.
      Parameters:
      pos - the new position for the player
      player - the player to move

    • accountWall

      public boolean accountWall()
      Check if maximum amount of walls has been placed on the board.
      Returns:
      true if less than 20 walls have been placed, false otherwise.

    • isWinnableForAll

      public boolean isWinnableForAll(Player[] players)
      Checks if the current board configuration allows all players to reach their respective goals.
      Parameters:
      players - Array of players in the game.
      Returns:
      true if all players can reach their goals, false otherwise.

    • isWinnable

      public boolean isWinnable(Pawn player)
      Check if a game board is winnable for a given player.
      Parameters:
      player - The Pawn of the player to check.
      Returns:
      true if the game is winnable for the player, false otherwise.

    • dfs

      public Set<Position> dfs(Position pos, Pawn player, Set<Position> marking, Set<Position> possibleDestination)
      Performs a depth-first search (DFS) on the game board from a given position.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position from which to start the DFS.
      player - The player for whom to perform the DFS.
      marking - A set of positions marking the nodes visited during the DFS.
      possibleDestination - The set of Positions representing the possible destinations for the Pawn.
      Returns:
      The updated marking set after performing the DFS.

    • roundOfPlay

      public void roundOfPlay(Player[] players, Integer turn, Scanner s)
      Handles the turn for a player.
      Parameters:
      players - Array of players in the game.
      turn - The current turn number.
      s - Scanner for input.
